title: How to Develop Film With Coffee and Washing Soda

steps.title: Fill a bucket with 1 qt.
steps.content: Fill a bucket with 1 qt. (or 1 L) of room temperature water.

steps.title: Dissolve 10 tsp.
steps.content: Dissolve 10 tsp. (or 50 grams) of washing soda completely into the water. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Dissolve 4 tsp.
steps.content: Dissolve 4 tsp. (or 5 grams) of ground coffee completely into the solution. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dissolve 1 tsp.
steps.content: Dissolve 1 tsp. (or 5 grams) of Vitamin C powder completely into the solution. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Wait up to 10 minutes for any bubbles to evaporate.
steps.content: Wait up to 10 minutes for any bubbles to evaporate.

steps.title: Make sure that you are in a completely dark area.
steps.content: Make sure that you are in a completely dark area.

steps.title: Load your film into the developing tank.
steps.content: Load your film into the developing tank. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the solution into the developing tank.
steps.content: Pour the solution into the developing tank. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.
steps.content: Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.

steps.title: Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.
steps.content: Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Continue for 10 to 20 minutes.
steps.content: Continue for 10 to 20 minutes.

steps.title: Pour the developing solution out.
steps.content: Pour the developing solution out.

steps.title: Pour in 1 qt.
steps.content: Pour in 1 qt. (or 1 L) of tap water.

steps.title: Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.
steps.content: Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.

steps.title: Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.
steps.content: Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Pour out the water after 10 minutes.
steps.content: Pour out the water after 10 minutes.

steps.title: Refill the tank with fresh tap water.
steps.content: Refill the tank with fresh tap water. Repeat the rinse process.

steps.title: Pour out the water after 10 minutes.
steps.content: Pour out the water after 10 minutes.

steps.title: Remove the film.
steps.content: Remove the film.

steps.title: Hang the film in a corner away from light, dust, and wind.
steps.content: Hang the film in a corner away from light, dust, and wind.

steps.title: Wait until the films are dry to see your developed images.
steps.content: Wait until the films are dry to see your developed images.
